column4: Simplified starting point for researchers and practitioners in bio-mining industry to evaluate techno-economics of emerging technologies
This TEA is created as a baseline example of what a copper chalcopyrite bio-leaching operation looks like at scale
Process boundaries: extraction through copper cathode production
Take a look at the PFD (process flow diagram) to get aquainted with the overall bio-leaching operation
The core process logic is laid out in the 'process' tab - use this to adjust further assumptions
The dashboard shows the resulting unit economics, and sensitivity testing
control panel for TEA, with high level summary stats and assumptions for key sensitivities
process flow diagram with brief descriptions of unit operations
end-to-end process flow mapping the mass and energy flows
set of specific assumptions around bio-leaching
financial assumptions in respective categories
COGS, operational expenses, SG&A
capex for each unit operation, and framework to aggregate & annualize capex costs
revenue-related assumptions
populates tornado based on sensitivity testing from main tab. Make sure assumptions in tornado match main page
top-down comparison of model outputs with data from validation detail sheets
validation details -- these sheets house reference data used to validate assumptions
General banking best practices (https://www.wallstreetprep.com/knowledge/financial-modeling/)
Hard coded numbers, assumptions
Calculated values, references within the same sheet
Links to other sheets
Sensitivity assumption, driven from 'main' sheet

column2: Developed by Homeworld Collective and Conductor Labs
For informational and planning purposes only. Actual results may vary. Users should exercise due diligence when applying model outputs.
